results.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
results.description:
About Us

Exo Digital is a high growth digital agency leading the charge in technological innovation. Our DNA is in experience design and we have a diverse team of designers, content strategists and technical wizards. Our goal is to produce memorable experiences for our clients and create a high impact working environment for our team.

 

The Role

We are looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to produce scalable software solutions for our clients and exciting internal projects. You’ll be part of a cross-functional team that’s responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to deployment.

As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you should be comfortable around both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries. You should also be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility.

 

What you’ll do
  • Development of new features
  • Perform code reviews of peer code contributions and provide clear and meaningful feedback
  • Mentor more junior members of the team
  • Perform technical tasks as needed to meet operational requirements
  • Assist the commercial team with project estimation and proposals

Requirements

What you have

  • Experience with AWS, HTML, CSS, JS, Node JS, React, React Native & Typescript
  • Good written and verbal communication
  • Managing and hosting domains
  • You have experience with coaching and mentoring other developers
  • You can oversee and drive projects forward
  • You're analytical and good at time management
  • Strong development experience in an agency environment would be an advantage
  • Experience with delivering software using agile methodologies
  • A full understanding of the product & feature delivery from the perspective of multiple stakeholders (merchants, 3rd party developers, peers, marketing)
Nice to have
  • Experience with Shopify liquid templating language
  • Experience with Contentful, Sanity or other headless CMS platforms
  • Experience with Terraform

Benefits

What we can offer
  • Flexible work arrangements - we really mean this! We’re outcome-driven rather than clock watchers. We’re here to accommodate different working styles to ensure you are being your most productive self.
  • Home office set up budget
  • Treats on your birthday
  • Training budget
  • Remote working - we’re accepting applicants across Australia.
  • Coworking space available whenever you change of scenery - available in our Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane co-working spaces
  • Monthly up-skilling and hackathon events - this year we’re up-skilling the team around Web3 technologies such as Blockchain, Cryptocurrency, AR/VR, NFTs and Metaverse
  • Monthly team bonding events - we’ll fly you from wherever you are in Australia to our office in Melbourne on a monthly basis to have fun in person!
  • Fun and vibrant culture – the best team! But we might be biased. We promise you won’t be disappointed.
  • Incentives for those who go above and beyond
  • Discretionary annual bonus

results.title: iOS Developer
results.description:
We are searching for an iOS Developer to join our client's growing team.

You will join a team that fuses art and technology to craft digital experiences. They have more than two decades of experience in the music, entertainment, technology, and automotive industries.

Working closely with product managers, designers, and backend engineers, you'll play an important role in enabling the newest technologies and experiences. You will build robust and maintainable products and features. You will empower companies and their users to bring a joint vision to life. results.title: Senior Backend Software Engineer
results.description:
We are hiring a Senior Backend Software Engineer, and we'd like you to consider joining us!

We are driven by eVisit's mission: to simplify healthcare delivery to everyone, everywhere. We are creating technology to make it simpler for patients to connect with doctors, without having to go into the office.

What you will be working on: Further strengthening our Healthcare interoperability platform. Enhancing our cloud-native, microservices-based, event-driven systems. Help us grow and expand your knowledge with: AWS services, CI/CD, microservices, TDD, messaging, and everything else that is needed to build highly scalable, resilient, and cost-effective software. You will have the opportunity to work side by side with other experienced developers.

Requirements

Required Qualifications

Experienced backend developer with at least 5+ years of hands-on experience with:

  • Message-driven, microservices-based architecture
  • Infrastructure as Code (IaC) like Pulumi
  • AWS serverless, SQS, Code pipeline
  • Ruby programming language
  • Designing and building backend web services and RESTful APIs
  • SQL databases and ORMs
  • Software testing best practices and tools like RSpec

Communication:

  • Sound technical writing and ability to express technical ideas fluently in English
  • Effective interpersonal, teamwork, and communication skills

Working hours:

  • We align to our office timezone (Mountain Standard Time)

Core Values:

  • We are looking for candidates who demonstrate our company values

Desired Qualifications

  • Experience working in a regulated environment (Healthcare experience HL7, EMRs)

Where’s the job?

We are 100% remote, and staying that way. We are able to hire engineers in all 50 states and internationally. You can work from wherever you want. Our team was distributed internationally even before the pandemic. It’s baked into how we work.

Our interview process (over video call):

  • 30 min call with the hiring manager
  • A take home coding exercise

Benefits

  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Great benefits package including medical, dental, vision, HSA & FSA plans

results.title: Senior Frontend Engineer, UI/UX Team
results.description:
Catalyst Overview

Catalyst is the world’s most intuitive Customer Success Platform (CSP), and was built by an experienced group of industry leaders. Our software integrates with all of the tools that CS teams are already using to provide one centralized view of customer data. Customer Success Managers can subsequently take the right actions to prevent churn, increase product adoption, and align the entire organization on a unified workflow to manage customers throughout their journey. Catalyst helps organizations turn Customer Success into a company-wide mission.

 

Position Overview

As a Senior Frontend Engineer, you will skillfully build our UI/UX while fostering the engineering culture and process as an early employee. Our tech stack consists of Vue.js, Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, and Elasticsearch on AWS. If you thrive in an early startup environment or are simply looking for more ownership and the ability to make a significant impact, we would love to meet you.

 

What You’ll Do

  • Collaborate with Product Managers, designers, and engineers to build enterprise-ready products
  • Design and implement high performance, reliable, and scalable systems
  • Write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code
  • Participate in peer code and design reviews
  • Make pragmatic scoping and design decisions to optimize project timelines and minimize risk
  • Translate ambiguous business problems into actionable tasks
  • Provide mentorship through active pairing and coaching
 

What You’ll Need

  • 5+ years of Javascript experience developing enterprise web applications
  • Strong understanding of CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS
  • Demonstrated expertise in a major reactive web framework (React, Vue)
  • History with one of the major flux pattern implementations (Redux, Vuex)
  • Mastery of asynchronous request handling, REST architectures, partial page updates, and AJAX
  • Experience working in a test-driven development environment
  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies
  • Keen eye for strong UX and a history contributing to design systems
  • Experience with Webpack
  • Experience with Ruby on Rails and a willingness to traverse the full stack (preferred)
  • Experience with relational databases such as PostgreSQL (preferred)


Why You’ll Love Working Here!

  • Highly competitive compensation package, including equity - everyone has a stake in our growth
  • Monthly Mental Health Days and Mental Health Weeks twice per year where the company takes off
  • Comprehensive benefits, including up to 100% paid medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage for you & your loved ones
  • Unlimited vacation policy, encouraging you to take the time you need - we trust you to strike the right work/life balance
  • Annual education stipend, to ensure that you're continuously expanding your skill set
  • Monthly wellness stipend, to ensure that you’re taking care of both your physical & mental health
  • Monthly remote team-building events, including game nights, trivia, cooking/mixology classes, and more!
 

Catalyst is an equal opportunity employer, meaning that we do not discriminate based upon race, religion, national origin, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, or any other protected class. We believe that diversity is more than just good intentions, and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

results.title: Senior Golang Engineer
results.description:
**About the Role**

Zero Hash is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help architect and build new features, as well as scaling the gateway to Finance 2.0. We are a high performing team looking for an equally ambitious and driven teammate.

 

The right candidate for this position is detail oriented, deeply technical, and driven. You are eager to learn new technologies and complex systems. You build resiliency and scalability into the platform at every step.

 

If you're looking to have a massive impact in a high-growth startup in one of the most exciting markets in decades, you will find this role challenging and rewarding in equal measure.

 

This fully remote role is open to candidates in any APAC timezone.

 

#LI-Remote

 

**Responsibilities**

* Support the company’s vital business by contributing to the design and  

  development of software in an event-driven microservices environment

* Develop microservices in Golang and Python

* Work with platform engineers to setup new services

* Respond to production issues and alerts

* When necessary, communicate directly with client technical teams

 

**Requirements**

* 5+ years of experience, preferably in the FinTech space

* A humble and scrappy get-it-done mindset; you’re resourceful and in your     

  element going from 0 to 1

* Excellent problem solving skills - can troubleshoot complex systems

* Deep Proficiency with at least one of Python and Golang and experience with  

  the other.

* Understanding of SQL and database schema design

* Comfort with ambiguity; the ability to independently lay out and test clear  

  hypotheses and solve problems without well-defined direction

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills

 

**Preferred**

* Bachelors in computer science or equivalent experience

* Experience with the SciPy stack, specifically Pandas

* Experience at a banking-as-a-service, brokerage-as a service, payment-as-a-   service business

* An understanding around financial services reconciliation tools

* Experience with digital assets

* Experience with yield-generating products

 

**Benefits Offered**

We believe that the best way to succeed is by having a happy, motivated and healthy team. We offer the following benefits:

* Healthcare Insurance: Zero Hash covers roughly 100% of employee premiums as well as a portion of spouse/children

* Vision & Dental Insurance

* Mental Health and Wellness Program

* Work equipment

* Equity Ownership and Early Exercise

* Maternity & Paternity Leave

* Educational budget of $1000

* WFH stipend of $500

* WeWork All Access Membership

* Visa Sponsorship

* 401k

 

**About Zero Hash**

Zero Hash is a B2B embedded infrastructure platform that allows any platform to integrate digital assets natively into their own customer experience quickly and easily (a matter of API endpoints). We power neo-banks, broker-dealers, and payment groups to offer digital asset trading and custody, crypto-backed rewards and round-ups programs as well as yield through staking and DeFi and NFTs.

 

Our thesis is very simple: every financial services firm will offer digital assets within the next 2 years and will do so through platforms such as Zero Hash. Zero Hash is defining the new FinTech vertical of digital-assets-as-a-service.

 

Clients include MoneyLion, Wirex, Deserve, MoonPay, Tastytrade. Backed by Point72 Ventures, NYCA, Bain Capital, Tastytrade.

 

**The Zero Hash Culture**

All Zero Hash employees are guided by the following characteristics and core principles:

* Independence/Ownership - An ability to work autonomously. Join Zero Hash, pitch ideas, and shape the work you do.

* Passion - We are innovating quickly and challenging the status quo. We want you to think big, be creative and ​make a difference every day.

* Collaborative - A good attitude and respect for others. We’re teammates, not co-workers. Everything we do is a shared success and equally a shared failure - we talk in terms of “we” not “me”.

* Initiative - An ability and passion for learning and asking questions. We will champion you, challenge you and push you to achieve your best - and we expect you to do the same.

* Empathy - An ability to listen, respect, and understand your co-workers, customers, and everyone you interact with no matter how different they are to you.

* Adaptability - An ability to respond quickly. We are in a fast-paced industry and so we expect you to be creative when solving a new problem and comfortable under pressure.

* Transparency - We believe that transparency is critical to empowering everyone to make the best decisions, both the company to its people and vice versa.

* Integrity - Integrity creates trust. As both an organization collectively and as individuals, it is our most valuable asset.

results.title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
results.description:
Catalyst Overview

Catalyst is the world’s most intuitive Customer Success Platform (CSP), and was built by an experienced group of industry leaders. Our software integrates with all of the tools that CS teams are already using to provide one centralized view of customer data. Customer Success Managers can subsequently take the right actions to prevent churn, increase product adoption, and align the entire organization on a unified workflow to manage customers throughout their journey. Catalyst helps organizations turn Customer Success into a company-wide mission. 

 

Position Overview

As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer at Catalyst, you will help shape our infrastructure and build the foundation our team relies on for the rapid delivery of our product. We’ll depend on you to instill best practices for building scalable distributed systems, with an emphasis on observability and fault tolerance. Our current stack consists of technologies such as Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, Kubernetes, and we are in the process of moving towards microservices and serverless.  If you thrive in a growth stage startup environment, and are looking for more ownership and the ability to have a large impact, we would love to meet you.

 

What You’ll Do

  • Manage our GCP and AWS infrastructure, with an emphasis on configuration as code
  • Keep our site and our services up and running or getting it back up and running quickly when failure occurs
  • Improve monitoring and work with developers to improve performance and reliability
  • Participate in technical design reviews and architecture planning
  • Debugging complex problems across an entire stack and creating solid solutions
  • Collaborate with product managers and developers to evolve our gitops delivery pipeline
  • Working closely with internal partners and teams to ensure that we ship software that meets security, SLA, and performance requirements
  • Help build our on-call policies and runbooks
  • Take ownership of projects and demonstrate a high level of accountability
  • Manage our data infrastructure and pipeline


What You’ll Need

  • 5+ years of experience building and maintaining cloud infrastructure for distributed production systems
  • 1+ year of experience as a backend engineer developing enterprise web applications
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Knows their way around a Unix/Linux shell, can write shell scripts, and understands Linux internals
  • Experience debugging complex problems
  • Experience designing, building, and operating large-scale production systems
  • Proficiency in Bash, Python, or other scripting languages
  • Experience in databases and data warehouses
 

Technologies You’ll Need

  • Demonstrated experience with configuration and orchestration tools such Terraform, Cloudformation and Ansible
  • Experience with containers, such as Docker or Kubernetes
  • Familiarity with the suite of GCP and AWS services
  • Experience operating and tuning data stores such as PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch
  • Experience with managing the infrastructure that backs data pipelines and data lakes such as Airflow and Snowflake

results.title: Senior Frontend Engineer
results.description:
About Arena Club:

We are a Series-A stage startup that is transforming the physical collecting experience to the digital world, starting with trading cards (e.g. baseball, basketball, pokemon). Arena Club is launching with an authentication/grading service, vaulting service, and marketplace, with plans to add on lending and other community features. We leverage computer vision, machine learning, and blockchain as foundational technologies underpinning the product.

We are backed by leading VCs including: M13, defy, Lightspeed Ventures, Elysian Park Ventures, and BAM Ventures and recently raised 10 Million in funding.  Our team is led by entrepreneur Brian Lee who cofounded Legal Zoom, The Honest Company, and ShoeDazzle.

What you'll be doing:

You can expect to be part of a small, fast-moving, and impactful founding team. We will count on you to:

  • Create an delightful e-commerce and marketplace experience for sports card collectors using React, NextJS
  • Work closely with stakeholders to understand the needs and problems to shipping solution
  • Work closely with our designers to bring to life Figma designs with rapid feedback and iteration cycles
We'd prefer you to have :
  • 5+ years of experience as a professional software engineer
  • Experience architecting eCommerce or marketplace products with third-party tools
  • Motivated by taking an unknown problem, sinking your teeth in, and coming up with a plan of attack
  • You are excited to build the company from scratch
  • You can understand and communicate trade offs between various solutions at technical and business level
  • You can build scalable systems that are well documented and tested as we finalize a design
Required Tech:
  • React / Next.js
  • Typescript + Node.js

 

Nice To Have:

 

  • GCP or AWS (SQS, S3, etc)
  • Docker

results.title: Implementation/Integration Engineer
results.description:
Role: Implementation/Integration Engineer

At Revnue, we are bringing the future of AI-powered contract management to the world. We believe AI has the ability to provide deep insights into contracts to businesses everywhere. Our extensible platform brings full traceability across Contracts, Assets, SaaS, Suppliers, and Customers for all organizations of all sizes and verticals. With Revnue, we are empowering businesses to uncover the enormous value hidden within contracts.  

Come join us where you'll have amazing growth potential and opportunities to help shape the future of Revnue and ensure customer success.

Job Summary:

  • Exciting Contract Management SaaS poised for growth and international expansion
  • Experienced leadership team with a great culture and fun place to work

 

About the Job:

We are looking for an Implementation/Integration Engineer to play a role in owning the Revnue platform integrations. Someone who can effectively communicate the impact of integrations on business processes and convey the importance of a strategy. As an Implementation/Integration Engineer, you are responsible for integration project delivery and success. You will be expected to contribute to optimizing and automating the company's integration landscape over the next few years by implementing and supporting scalable business processes to support the company's growth and initiatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, implement and support interfaces and integrations across a broad range of systems — including commercial applications and custom-built solutions.
  • Evaluate existing components or systems to determine integration requirements and ensure that the final solutions meet organizational needs.
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to team members to solve problems and oversee the usage of best practices and technologies.
  • Collaborate regularly with other departments to improve processes or procedures
  • Manage multiple client implementations simultaneously
  • Conduct review with customer prior to release to confirm acceptance of data and configuration
  • Build solutions with custom frontends and backend services that automate business processes.
  • Integrate third-party products into internal systems as well as support and upgrade implemented systems.
  • Accurately forecast activation dates and manage implementation appropriately to meet release dates
  • Interpret and understand client business requirements
  • Identify, assist and test enhancements to workflow, scripts, or system defects for core functions
  • Conduct quality assurance of data migrations prior to release to the customer
  • Integrate Revnue across different platforms
  • Other tasks that may be assigned to you related to your role.



Requirements:

  • Bachelor's or Graduate's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Technology or equivalent experience.
  • Experience in using IPaaS tools (Make, Celigo, Workato, Integrately, Zapier is mandatory)
  • Knowledgeable with API's, experience with Javascript and Python is a plus
  • Knowledge of best practices in integration standards and approaches
  • Willingness to learn, accept new ideas and be independent
  • Self-starter who can communicate, organize, make decisions, solve problems, and manage time well



Revnue is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Revnue is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or another legally protected status.

results.title: Software Engineer 2158 HMIS NWSOL
results.description:
Location: Richland, WA
Title: Software Engineer
Schedule (FT/PT): FT
Travel Required: As Needed
Clearance: Ability to Obtain

North Wind Solutions is a Government contracting small business with operations at military and civilian installations across the United States. The company's focus is facilities operation and maintenance, waste management and radiological services, security control and force protection, and environmental services.

Job Description

The North Wind Enterprise Application Services organization develops and maintains hundreds of custom and commercial-off-the-shelf software applications at the Hanford Site in Richland, WA. This is one of the largest environmental cleanup projects in the world, focused on river protection, habitat restoration, and environmental remediation. The enterprise is in the midst of a major modernization effort towards a more agile methodology. In this phase of the transformation, the organization must maintain current software development processes while implementing new, agile processes alongside them.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

This position will be part of a strong team providing software engineering support to design, develop, operate and maintain software programs. Software engineering support also includes the assessment, maintenance, documentation, modernization, testing, and implementation functions. Responsibilities may include both the the production of new systems and web applications and support of legacy systems.

The software engineer will provide development and support for a variety of custom applications, as well as integration of Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) products into the enterprise ecosystem. Support and development will include .NET, ColdFusion and other programming languages with back-end databases developed in Microsoft SQL Server or Oracle.

The software engineer is responsible for designing, building, and implementing software. Specific duties include but are not limited to the following:

  • Develop and maintain software using .NET and other technologies
  • Design databases and work closely with SQL and/or Oracle database administrators to implement them into production environments
  • Understand and follow modern agile Software Development Lifecycle processes & procedures
  • Work and follow best practices in a DevSecOps environment, in close collaboration with Infrastructure and Cybersecurity colleagues
  • Work closely with customers, project managers, and other developers to understand user needs and deliver elegant solutions
  • Design and develop test cases
  • Analyze and monitor existing systems to provide recommendations for improvement
  • Troubleshoot software production issues
  • Assist with providing estimates
  • Assist with gathering requirements from customers
  • Develop technical documentation
  • Provide recommendations for continuous improvements

This software engineer will be expected to work independently with general supervision, resolve problems and issues with a wide array of knowledge and use leadership abilities to influence others within the job area through explanation of facts, policies and practices.

    Qualifications

    Education and Experience:

    • BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field OR a combination of education and work experience plus 3-4 years of related experience in computer application development and/or COTS support.
    • Minimum of 3 years' relevant experience in a multi-platform environment in application and database development with significant involvement in developing projects using .NET technology.
    • Minimum of 1 year of experience with AzureDevOps and/or the Agile Framework.

    Desired Experience

    • Experience working on Project Controls/Financial applications and systems
    • Experience developing in Cold Fusion
    • Experience working in a DevSecOps environment
    • · Experience developing applications using Git source control

    Skills and Abilities:

    • You have proven strong organizational skills, as well as working under tight deadlines
    • You have a commitment to teamwork and collaboration that is grounded in your capacity for empathy
    • You are passionate about clear communication and equally comfortable with written and verbal communications mediums
    • You are highly self-motivated and self-directed
    • You have the vision and mindset to identify, handle, and resolve problems quickly before they become recurring issues
    • You are a lifelong learner who displays adaptability in the face of changing circumstances
    • You have a honed sense of professionalism and analytical skill around office procedures and equipment such as telephone communications, business processes, and record-keeping
    • You have the ability to navigate problems and work independently, with some general supervision
    • You are familiar with  software quality assurance and software testing principles    

    SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:

    • Proof of USA citizenship will be required as a condition of employment.
    • Must pass pre-employment background check
    • Must pass pre-employment drug screening
    • Applicants are required to have REAL ID ACT compliant documentation at time of hire and nothing on record that would prohibit you from gaining access to Department of Energy sites

    WORKING ENVIRONMENT:

    This is a remote position.

      North Wind offers a competitive pay and benefits package to include health, life, and disability insurance benefits, 401(k) with company match, generous paid leave and tuition reimbursement for eligible employees. As a company, we are committed to employee wellness, professional development, and work-life balance. We value safety, reliability, and commitment to our people! For more information about our benefits or hiring philosophy, visit the North Wind Career Opportunities Page.

      Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The nature of those accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact our Helpline +1.208.528.8718 or use the Request for Reasonable Accommodation form to get assistance.

      North Wind is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, religion, or other legally protected status.
